Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)
The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Earn \Earn\ ([~e]rn), n. (Zo["o]l.) See {Ern}, n. --Sir W. Scott. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Earn \Earn\ ([~e]rn), v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Earned} ([~e]rnd); p. pr. & vb. n. {Earning}.] [AS. earnian; akin to OHG. arn[=o]n to reap, aran harvest, G. ernte, Goth. asans harvest, asneis hireling, AS. esne; cf. Icel. ["o]nn working season, work.] 1. To merit or deserve, as by labor or service; to do that which entitles one to (a reward, whether the reward is received or not). [1913 Webster]
The high repute Which he through hazard huge must earn. --Milton. [1913 Webster]
2. To acquire by labor, service, or performance; to deserve and receive as compensation or wages; as, to earn a good living; to earn honors or laurels. [1913 Webster]
I earn that [what] I eat. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
The bread I have earned by the hazard of my life or the sweat of my brow. --Burke. [1913 Webster]
{Earned run} (Baseball), a run which is made without the assistance of errors on the opposing side.
Syn: See {Obtain}. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Earn \Earn\ ([~e]rn), v. t. & i. [See 1st {Yearn}.] To grieve. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Earn \Earn\, v. i. [See 4th {Yearn}.] To long; to yearn. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]
And ever as he rode, his heart did earn To prove his puissance in battle brave. --Spenser. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Earn \Earn\, v. i. [AS. irnan to run. [root]11. See {Rennet}, and cf. {Yearnings}.] To curdle, as milk. [Prov. Eng.] [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: Virtual Entity of Relevant Acronyms (Version 1.9, June 2002)

Definition.WordDefinition: earn v 1: earn on some commercial or business transaction; earn as salary or wages; "How much do you make a month in your new job?"; "She earns a lot in her new job"; "this merger brought in lots of money"; "He clears $5,000 each month" [syn: {gain}, {take in}, {clear}, {make}, {realize}, {realise}, {pull in}, {bring in}] 2: acquire or deserve by one's efforts or actions [syn: {garner}]
